Was just walking the dog at a very affluent Northern Beaches (Sydney) beach.

Two men 45ish, also walking dogs, were chatting. They didn't know whether $TSLA was a subject best avoided (on Christmas Day) or whether it was time to double down.

Biotech is hard, but there has always been something a little comical about Ipsen, a degree of non-natural incompetence.

I once owned the stock. I even made money on it - but it was and remains a horrid value trap.

3/3

Ipsen paid $1.3 billion for Clementia, the single asset being a late-stage drug palovarotene.

They spent several hundred million more getting it to failure.

It is - apart from strong family ownership - hard to see how Ipsen should remain an independent company.

2/3
